This is a market activity. In the case of services or immobile infrastructures, markets are connecting suppliers and consumers at a global level. For specific connections at regional level, direct links between the local producing activities and the local consumers are preferred. Transport or losses are logically not relevant for this type of products.;This is the market for  'hard coal preparation plant', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;This is an immobile infrastructure, representing the construction of a hard coal preparation plant. The infrastructure is a preparation of run-of-mine (R.O.M) hard coal, including screening, crushing, washing, etc. It has an average yearly capacity of coal washeries (for thermal coal) of 4.38 million metric tons and an average lifetime of 30 years. The process includes input materials, infrastructure, machinery, energy consumption during the production and decommission.     

This activity starts with the built infrastructure ready to use.

This activity ends with the infrastructure made accessible to the users. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
